newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's March mined gold output rises 5.3 percent.
newsitem.headline: Peru's March mined gold output rises 5.3 percent.

text.p: Peru's gold output rose 5.3 percent to 5.57 tonnes in March compared with the same month last year, according to preliminary figures released Thursday by the Energy and Mines Ministry.
Gold output rose 7.6 percent to 16.64 tonnes in the first quarter, compared with the same period last year, the ministry added in its monthly report.
Peru's gold production in 1996 rose 12.2 percent to 64.8 tonnes from 57.7 tonnes.

Peru is Latin America's second largest gold producer after Brazil and the 12th largest in the world. The country's largest gold producer is Minera Yanacocha S.A., a joint venture operated by U.S.-based Newmont Mining Co..
The ministry's figures include estimates for output by Peru's informal gold miners, who account for about 40 percent of national output.
